title: Most of the casualties in Seoul are teens or people in their 20s, fire chief says
Stretchers line Seoul street to take away bodies
Stretchers line Seoul street to take away bodies
At least 150 people are also injured, officials say. While the cause of the deaths is unknown, authorities report cases of people suffering from 'cardiac arrest.'
At least 100 people are also injured, officials say. While the cause of the deaths is unknown, authorities report cases of people suffering from 'cardiac arrest.'
At least 120 people killed in the Seoul Halloween incident, fire chief says
CNN reporter shows what's happening after deadly incident in Seoul
description: Dozens of people in South Korea's capital of Seoul are receiving medical assistance after an incident during Halloween festivities in the city, according to Yonhap News Agency. CNN's Will Ripley reports.

title: What we know and still don't know about the attack on Paul Pelosi
description: The man who is alleged to have attacked Paul Pelosi, the husband of House Speaker Nancy Pelosi, in the couple's San Francisco home on Friday is expected to be charged with multiple felonies Monday, according San Francisco law enforcement officials. He is expected to be arraigned on Tuesday.

title: Dozens of people suffer 'cardiac arrest' during Halloween festivities in Seoul
description: Dozens of people in South Korea's capital of Seoul are receiving medical assistance after an incident during Halloween festivities in the city, according to Yonhap News Agency.

title: A major grain deal between Russian and Ukraine is now paused indefinitely
description: Russia will suspend its participation in the United Nations-brokered grain export deal with Ukraine after drone attacks on the Crimean city of Sevastopol, the country's defense ministry announced Saturday.

title: 13 people were rescued from a fishing boat that collided with a container ship off the Virginia coast
description: The US Coast Guard, with an assist from good Samaritans, rescued 13 people from a sinking fishing boat after it collided with a container ship about 60 miles off the coast of Virginia on Friday.

title: A space rock slammed into Mars on Christmas Eve. It revealed a hidden surprise
description: You never forget your first Mars mission.

title: Jake Paul vs. Anderson Silva: How to watch, fight time and what to know
description: When Anderson Silva was breaking records as the most dominant MMA fighter of his generation, Jake Paul was a child watching at home, transfixed by the Brazilian's achievements.

title: Tesla ATV for kids recalled for violating safety standards
description: The Tesla Cyberquads for Kids, made by Radio Flyer, has been recalled because it doesn't meet federal safety standards. Owners are being offered a full refund after they disable the electric all-terrain vehicle.

title: Debt ceiling fights aren't new. The next one could unleash 'Armageddon'
description: The market for US Treasuries, worth roughly $24 trillion, is considered the world's most important. Its smooth operation directly impacts both America's ability to run its government, and the health of the broader financial system, which hinges on the view among traders that US debt is a safe bet.

title: Kanye West's antisemitism did what his anti-Blackness did not. And some people have a problem with that
description: On the surface, the case of Kanye West seems pretty cut and dry.

title: Dozens of earthquakes detected as Hawaii's Mauna Loa, world's largest active volcano, remains in 'state of heightened unrest'
description: The Hawaii County Civil Defense Agency on Friday issued a volcano advisory alert after 36 small earthquakes were detected between Thursday and Friday near Mauna Loa, earth's largest active volcano, which "continues to be in a state of heightened unrest," according to an update from the United States Geological Survey.

title: Make Halloween evil again
description: There's a time and a place for empathy. On a plane with a screaming baby, when a sick colleague leaves work early and when friends blithely announce plans for a destination wedding, a little empathy can go a long way. As I recently discovered, however, there is one occasion from which empathy should be banished forever: Halloween.

title: Antarctica's emperor penguins at risk of extinction due to the climate crisis
description: As Antarctica's emperor penguins are increasingly threatened by the climate crisis, the flightless seabirds will receive new protections under the Endangered Species Act, or ESA.

title: A White House speechwriter on writing for Obama, Biden as Kool-Aid man and being a 'full Swiftie'
description: The idea for Cody Keenan's New York Times best-selling first book came from a viral tweet storm.

title: Zelensky says Russia's mobilized troops are poorly trained and equipped
Ahead of the US midterms, here's a reminder of how elections work
description: https://cnn.it/3DIPTK0

title: Zelensky says Russia's mobilized troops are poorly trained and equipped
Why some have reacted with fury to Manchester United star's showboating
description: It was a moment of exquisite but ultimately unnecessary skill.

title: Inside the world of real-life vampires in New Orleans and Atlanta
description: When Maven Lore was being fitted for his first set of fangs, a switch within him flipped on.

title: LeBron James makes history but Lakers' nightmare start to season continues
description: LeBron James made history on Friday but could do little to stop the LA Lakers' nightmare start to the season from continuing.

title: An officer was reunited with the baby he helped deliver and rescue at the US-Mexico border
description: A US Customs and Border Protection officer was reunited with a young girl who he helped deliver at the US-Mexico border six years ago.

title: Analysis: Elon Musk owning Twitter should give everyone pause
description: In late May, something unusual happened at Twitter. Shareholders voted to approve two proposals to change how the company operates — and did so against Twitter's recommendations.

title: Die-hard NASCAR fan wins six-figure lottery jackpot by honoring Dale Earnhardt with his pick
description: One North Carolina man's longtime support of NASCAR legend Dale Earnhardt paid off big-time when he won over $200,000 in the lottery.

title: House majority leader reflects on 20 years since first federal voting systems legislation enactment and how the fight over voting system legitimacy has shifted
description: The first piece of modern federal legislation to address the infrastructure of voting systems across the country, known as Help America Vote Act, celebrates its 20th anniversary on Saturday.

title: They fled a Boko Haram massacre. Now, after years in refugee camps, families return to rebuild their lives
description: It is a sight Ya Lewa Aji says she can never forget: a baby strapped to her mother's back, shot dead while the mother lay lifeless on the floor.

title: 8-year-old boy becomes youngest person to climb California's El Capitan
description: An 8-year-old boy became the youngest person to finish climbing El Capitan in California's Yosemite National Park on Friday, according to his father, who has been by his side and cheering him on since the pair began their journey earlier this week.

title: The Happy Meal inventor says McDonald's didn't want it at first
description: McDonald's said this week that it sold half of its new Happy Meals geared toward adults in just four days. But four decades ago, when the first Happy Meal debuted, the company didn't quite get it.

title: Women could once again make up a pivotal swing vote in November
description: Republicans are bullish that this could the year of the "security mom" -- the moment when women who abandoned the GOP during Donald Trump's presidency gravitate back toward Republican nominees who are speaking to their worries about the economic and physical security of their families.

title: How to survive a cobra bite -- or better yet, avoid one entirely
description: Thailand is full of snakes -- more than 200 species, including cobras. That might be unsettling for some people, but it was ideal for Prangmart Charoenwai as a boy in southern Thailand.

title: Spooky spots to explore from the US to Asia
description: In travel news this week, we bring you America's eeriest cities, the world's most elusive shipwrecks and National Geographic's top places to visit in 2023.

title: A Colorado train passenger looked out the window -- and found a missing hiker
description: A Colorado train passenger helped lead to the rescue of a missing, injured hiker after she spotted her through a train window.

title: Russia says it has repelled a drone attack on Crimea
description: Russian Black Sea warships have repelled a drone attack in Sevastopol Bay, a Russian official in Crimea said on Saturday.

title: What causes armies to lose the will to fight? Here's what history tells us -- and what Putin may soon find out
description: It was one of the strangest episodes in military history, an event so unusual that it was first treated as a myth.

title: As Brazil cracks down on fake news, Bolsonaro's new move is straight out of Trump's playbook
description: After Donald Trump's 2020 reelection bid failed, some supporters claimed that the media and social media had been unfair to the former President -- a narrative that continues to resonate among his base today.

title: Guns, God and fake news dominate Brazil's presidential race
description: The thundering sound of gunfire reverberates through a room during a seemingly endless barrage.

title: US official's suggestion of 'arms-control' talks with North Korea raises eyebrows
description: The United States said on Friday its policy towards North Korea had not changed after a senior US official responsible for nuclear policy raised some eyebrows by saying Washington would be willing to engage in arms-control talks with Pyongyang.

title: 72 dead as Tropical Storm Nalgae hits Philippines
description: Tropical Storm Nalgae has killed at least 72 people and injured 33 in the Philippines, the country's disaster agency said Saturday.

title: Leader of Russia's notorious Wagner group believed to have confronted Putin about the war
description: Yevgeny Prigozhin, the leader of a brutal, private army known as the Wagner Group, is now challenging Russia's Minister of Defense Sergei Shoigu. American officials believe Prigozhin confronted President Vladimir Putin himself about the mismanagement of the war. CNN's Melissa Bell reports.

title: Plans for Singapore's first 'supertall' skyscraper unveiled
description: Singapore is set to welcome its first ever "supertall" skyscraper, a term used to describe buildings that exceed 300 meters (984 feet) in height.

title: Ukrainians are dreading the 'darkest winter' as Russia takes aim at the power grid
description: As winter edges ever closer in Ukraine, Alla Melnychuk and her neighbors are racing against the time to save what little they have left.

title: Time to accept North Korea has the bomb?
description: As a statement of intent, it was about as blunt as they get.
